page.title: 19Religion in Dean
page.content: The focal point of Upper Dean is the church. It is now in group of 6 churches - the Stodden churches comprising, Dean, Melchbourne, Pertenhall, Shelton, Swineshead and Yelden - with 1 vicar who is resident in Dean. There is a family service with Communion at 10am on Sunday at each church in turn. At this service there is usually a "Sunday Club" and creche for the younger members of the congregation. A choir has now been established to perform on several occasions throughout the year. There is also an early service and evensong so that in most instances every village has a service of some kind each Sunday. There is also a Chapel in Dean that holds services in the Old Schoolroom fortnightly.
